header_summary:
Antoine Riard highlights the evolution of Bitcoin Core's development culture, reflecting on the shifts caused by contentious debates and the introduction of open-source grants, which, while supportive, have led to a reluctance in critical code review due to fear of financial repercussions on grant re-attribution. The changes have also led to discussions on forking the core or establishing multiple security mailing lists to maintain a collaborative culture and improve security issue handling practices within the community. [Read more](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/Zp6TTAJ399CKbY5s@petertodd.org/T/#mb46ac8857c6aeaad982ae33610c78ae238205302)

Luke Dashjr discusses the complexity of addressing block withholding in cryptocurrency mining, suggesting that decentralization does not necessarily increase risks but may improve detection. Skepticism about certain mitigation proposals highlights the need for nuanced solutions that don't disadvantage any mining structure, with a hardfork considered as a potential solution to close vulnerabilities. [Learn more](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/6f7feb2b-2e24-4081-b555-db69f34d308e@dashjr.org/T/#m6d16483cdef824b1b673cd9c7ca9a57a78b76570)

Weiji Guo's discussion emphasizes the necessity of selecting appropriate cryptographic curves for implementing Dory, highlighting the contrast with secp256k1 and the importance of transparency and scalability in cryptographic solutions. This underscores the complexities in choosing frameworks that meet technical and operational requirements. [Further details](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/93611162-6029-4308-98b5-3c95b30a2ac9n@googlegroups.com/T/#mb86812df7a3c3f2aaaee04feddf48b83132d55c)

recent_posts.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core's development culture evolved significantly over 15 years, shaped by contributor backgrounds.
- Changes post-"block size war" led to less rigor and more emphasis on professionalization and grant funding.
- Efforts to address security and collaboration concerns include possible forking and more transparent review processes.

recent_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
recent_posts.summary:
- Decentralizing mining may improve detection of block withholding practices.
- Proposed solutions for block withholding may inadvertently favor centralized mining operations.
- A hardfork is considered as a definitive solution to block withholding challenges.

recent_posts.title: OP_ZKP updates
recent_posts.summary:
- Dory requires pairing-friendly curves, unlike secp256k1, for full functionality.
- Its implementation demands careful curve selection to harness Dory's capabilities effectively.
- Despite its larger proof size, Dory offers transparency and efficiency, presenting a complex choice.

recent_posts.title: Cluster mempool: block building with sub-chunk granularity
recent_posts.summary:
- Sophisticated strategies construct block templates by selecting transaction chunks based on fee rate.
- Refinements include using smaller subsets of chunks to fill blocks more effectively.
- A branch-and-bound search algorithm maximizes fee yield using precomputed absorption sets.

recent_posts.title: Hyperion: A discrete time network event simulator for Bitcoin (Core)
recent_posts.summary:
- The Erlay initiative was revived to improve Bitcoin nodes' bandwidth efficiency.
- Hyperion, an event-based network simulator, was created to analyze transaction relaying in Bitcoin.
- The project seeks community contributions to refine and extend Hyperion's functionalities.

active_posts.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core
active_posts.summary:
- Peter Todd discusses a Bitcoin vulnerability related to "free" relay attacks.
- He suggests enabling full Replace-By-Fee (RBF) to mitigate these vulnerabilities.
- Todd criticizes Bitcoin Core's disregard for security concerns and suggests revisiting their decision-making.

active_posts.title: OP_ZKP updates
active_posts.summary:
- The OP_ZKP initiative aims to incorporate ZKPs into Bitcoin, selecting an efficient scheme.
- The Inner Product Argument (IPA) is a promising solution, meeting core requirements but facing scalability challenges.
- Future strategies may explore alternatives like Dory if IPA's implementation issues persist, affecting performance.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion critiques Stratum V2’s impracticality for mining pools due to block withholding attacks.
- It suggests a negotiated template approach and out-of-band payments to enhance mining security and efficiency.
- The email advocates for changes including expanding nonce space and altering the PoW algorithm to sustain mining decentralization.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis suggests improvements for Bitcoin's security and efficiency, highlighting vulnerabilities.
- Proposed solutions include adjusting mining difficulty and limiting non-SegWit transaction sizes.
- Community debate arises over suggestions like reducing block size limit, affecting scalability.

active_posts.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts.summary:
- Stable Channels integrates bitcoin with the Lightning network for dollar balance stability.
- It aims to minimize bitcoin's volatility and counterparty risk without external dependencies.
- The project explores usability, extends to other assets, and considers decentralized finance innovations.

active_posts.title: V3 and some possible futures
active_posts.summary:
- The V3 policy's current form has limitations, including issues with batch CPFP and ANYONCANPAY transactions.
- Future proposals, such as V3.0.5 and V4 series, aim to enhance flexibility and address pinning concerns.
- The goal is evolving transaction policies for a robust, user-friendly framework compatible with dynamic mempools.

today_in_history_posts.title: Improving JoinMarket's resistance to sybil attacks using fidelity bonds
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rented TXO fidelity bonds could centralize risk and decrease privacy in bitcoin transactions.
- The attacker renting coins from multiple entities could lead to a more potent centralization risk.
- Despite potential downsides, the goal is to enhance privacy without compromising bitcoin’s inherent features.

today_in_history_posts.title: Trampoline Routing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Trampoline routing enables deferred route calculation in lightning networks via trampoline nodes.
- Nodes peel layers of the "onion" to forward payments, integrating fees and cltv requirements.
- A gossip filter system, reusing BIP37 infrastructure, facilitates exchange of trampoline fees and cltv details.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive and active investments are two distinct strategies, the former involving minimal involvement.
- The post highlights passive investment's societal issues, like asset value misalignment and potential for lower asset demand.
- It suggests central banks could stabilize economies using inflationary currencies backed by deflationary ones like Bitcoin.
